Hello: For some reason Ubuntu is not letting me have two routers plugged in (wireless, nic). Only one has internet connection connected. When both connections are enabled, nobody can connect to my computer (VNC, HTTP).

For some reason Ubuntu is not letting me have two routers plugged in (wireless, nic). Only one has internet connection connected. When both connections are enabled, nobody can connect to my computer (VNC, HTTP). Can someone help?
You can only have one default route
So how can I disable the other default route? I just want to be able to connec to PCS on both routers, only receive internet from one.
Which connection is the internet connected to the wireless or wired ?
remove the line at the very bottom of the file which says gateway 192.168.0.1 (run gksudo gedit /etc/network/interfaces)
will i be able to enter the configuration page?
yes presuming the router is on 192.168.0.1

Then after you have edited the file run 'sudo ifdown eth0 && sudo ifdown eth1 && sudo ifup eth0 && sudo ifup eth1' (If you have other stuff on other networks behind the router read about setting up static routes)
